column4: Hi. My system started to get extremely slow especially with browsing. Is there any way I could fix that? Last week the pc was alright..
how much ram? how much free space on / and /home?
I don't know really. I am running Conky and the graph is full!
free ram: "free -m" (row buffers/cache, column free), harddisk: "df -h"
am i going to lose any data?
no
typing 'free -m' & 'df -h' only lists some figures
total       used       free     shared    buffers     cached
use a pastebin or write the relevant entries
http://pastebin.com/y3XVY70e
what's next?
pastebin.com doesn't seem to work here (blocked)
http://paste.ubuntu.com/641983/
well... ram and hd space doesn't seem to be the problem... as long as you don't open a few ram intensive applications like libreoffice, gimp oder browsers at the same time
I'm just running firefox alone..
Well, along with X-Chat here..
maybe check with "top", which daemons/programs are using you resources
there is something called plugin'containe'
there is something called 'plugin-containe'. As soon as I ran 'top', containe was running %93! now it's around 8.
perhaps you have activated some fancy desktop-window-stuff, which need some time and cpu
I will remove this plugin and restart pc.
